result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel W Knowlton Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: or 24 hours of community service  - defendant chose community service
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel W Knowlton Jr.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice and Judgment of Conviction to Defendant. USPS indicates moved left no address; return to sender; unable to forward.

10:29 AM 22CM231 & 22CM338. Defendant Gabriel W Knowlton Jr. in court without counsel. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM338 Disorderly Conduct. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court orders 3 days jail or 24 hours of community service, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Defendant has 1 day of jail credit. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.

RETURN TO SENDER. Per USPS label: Moved-Left No address; unable to forward.
